field: Dry seed (seed dressing takes place at stage 00), P, V: Winter dormancy or resting period
notes: We don't include dormancy as a phenological stage.

field: Beginning of seed imbibition, P, V: Beginning of bud swelling
notes: We don't include dormancy as a phenological stage. Also this is two stages at once. Can't use without more information.

field: Seed imbibition complete, P, V: End of bud swelling
notes: We don't include dormancy as a phenological stage. Also this is two stages at once. Can't use without more information.

field: Radicle (root) emerged from seed, P, V: Perennating organs forming roots
notes: We don't address underground phenology. Also this is two stages at once. Can't use without more information.

field: Elongation of radicle, formation of root hairs and /or lateral roots
notes: We don't address underground phenology.

field: G: Coleoptile emerged from caryopsis, D, M: Hypocotyl with cotyledons or shoot breaking through seed coat, P, V: Beginning of sprouting or bud breaking
notes: This is two stages at once. Can't use without more information about below versus above ground.

field: D: Hypocotyl with cotyledons growing towards soil surface, P, V: Shoot growing towards soil surface
notes: We don't address underground phenology.

field: G: First true leaf emerged from coleoptile, D, M: Cotyledons completely unfolded, P: First leaves separated

G: Emergence: Coleoptile breaks through soil surface, D, M: Emergence: Cotyledons break through soil surface(except hypogeal germination),D, V: Emergence: Shoot/leaf breaks through soil surface, P: Bud shows green tips
notes: This is multiple stages at once. Can use as a stage but not as a trait.

field: G: First true leaf emerged from coleoptile, D, M: Cotyledons completely unfolded, P: First leaves separated
First true leaf, leaf pair or whorl unfolded, P: First leaves unfolded
notes: There might also be expanding leaves present but we don't know.

field: 2 true leaves, leaf pairs or whorls unfolded
notes: There might also be expanding leaves present but we don't know.

field: 3 true leaves, leaf pairs or whorls unfolded
notes: There might also be expanding leaves present but we don't know.

field: 4 true leaves, leaf pairs or whorls unfolded
notes: There might also be expanding leaves present but we don't know.

field: 5 true leaves, leaf pairs or whorls unfolded
notes: There might also be expanding leaves present but we don't know.

field: 6 true leaves, leaf pairs or whorls unfolded
notes: There might also be expanding leaves present but we don't know.

field: 7 true leaves, leaf pairs or whorls unfolded
notes: There might also be expanding leaves present but we don't know.

field: 8 true leaves, leaf pairs or whorls unfolded
notes: There might also be expanding leaves present but we don't know.

field: 9 or more true leaves, leaf pairs or whorls unfolded
notes: There might also be expanding leaves present but we don't know.

field: First side shoot visible, G: First tiller visible
notes: I am assuming that plant does not start branching until after mature leaves are present.

field: 2 side shoots visible, G: 2 tillers visible
4 side shoots visible, G: 4 tillers visible
5 side shoots visible, G: 5 tillers visible
6 side shoots visible, G: 6 tillers visible
7 side shoots visible, G: 7 tillers visible
8 side shoots visible, G: 8 tillers visible
9 or more side shoots visible, G: 9 or more tillers visible
Onset of height growth (e.g. Pinus, Picea)
Onset of height growth (e.g. Pinus, Picea)
Stem (rosette) 10% of final length (diameter), G: 1 node detectable
notes: Assuming the normal pattern in which mature leaves correspond to nodes.

field: Stem (rosette) 20% of final length (diameter), G: 2 nodes detectable
Stem (rosette) 30% of final length (diameter), G: 3 nodes detectable
Stem (rosette) 40% of final length (diameter), G: 4 nodes detectable
Stem (rosette) 50% of final length (diameter), G: 5 nodes detectable
Stem (rosette) 60% of final length (diameter), G: 6 nodes detectable
Stem (rosette) 70% of final length (diameter), G: 7 nodes detectable
Stem (rosette) 80% of final length (diameter), G: 8 nodes detectable
Maximum stem length or rosette diameter reached, G: 9 or more nodes detectable, end of height growth (e.g. Pinus, Picea
Harvestable vegetative plant parts or vegetatively propagated organs begin to develop
notes: Can't map this without knowing the species.

field: G: Flag leaf sheath extending
G: Flag leaf sheath extending
Harvestable vegetative plant parts or vegetatively propagated organs have reached 30% of final size, G: Flag leaf sheath just visibly swollen (mid-boot)
notes: Can't use this with vegetative parts unless we know the taxon.

field: Harvestable vegetative plant parts or vegetatively propagated organs have reached 30% of final size, G: Flag leaf sheath just visibly swollen (mid-boot)
notes: For grains it is explicit.

field: Harvestable vegetative plant parts or vegetatively propagated organs have reached 50% of final size, G: Flag leaf sheath swollen (late-boot)
notes: Can't use this with vegetative parts unless we know the taxon.

field: Harvestable vegetative plant parts or vegetatively propagated organs have reached 50% of final size, G: Flag leaf sheath swollen (late-boot)
notes: For grains it is explicit.

field: Harvestable vegetative plant parts or vegetatively propagated organs have reached 70% of final size, G: Flag leaf sheath opening
notes: Can't use this with vegetative parts unless we know the taxon.

field: Harvestable vegetative plant parts or vegetatively propagated organs have reached 70% of final size, G: Flag leaf sheath opening
notes: For grains it is explicit.

field: Maximum of total tuber mass reached, tubers detach easily from stolons, skin set not yet complete (skin easily removable with thumb)
notes: We don't address underground phenology.

field: Harvestable vegetative plant parts or vegetatively propagated organs have reached final size, G: First awns visible, Skinset complete
notes: Can't use this with vegetative parts unless we know the taxon.

field: Harvestable vegetative plant parts or vegetatively propagated organs have reached final size, G: First awns visible, Skinset complete
notes: For grains it is explicit.

field: Flower buds present, still enclosed by leaves (oilseed rape)
Inflorescence or flower buds visible, G: Beginning of heading
First individual flowers visible (still closed), G: Half of inflorescence emerged (middle of heading)
First flower petals visible (in petalled forms), G: Inflorescence fully emerged (end of heading)
Beginnin of flowering: first flowers open (sporadically)
Beginning of flowering: 10% of flowers open
20% of flowers open
30% of flowers open, maize: male beginning of pollen shedding, female: tips of stigmata visible
40% of flowers open
Full flowering: 50% of flowers open, first petals may be fallen
Flowering finishing: majority of petals fallen or dry
End of flowering: fruit set visible
10% of fruits have reached final size or fruit has reached 10% of final size, G: Caryopsis watery ripe
20% of fruits have reached final size or fruit has reached 20% of final size
30% of fruits have reached final size or fruit has reached 30% of final size, G: Early milk
40% of fruits have reached final size or fruit has reached 40% of final size
50% of fruits have reached final size or fruit has reached 50% of final size, G: Milky ripe, medium milk
60% of fruits have reached final size or fruit has reached 60% of final size
70% of fruits have reached final size or fruit has reached 70% of final size, G: Late milk
80% of fruits have reached final size or fruit has reached 80% of final size
Nearly all fruits have reached final size
olive: fruit deep green colour becomes lightgreen, yellowish
Beginning of ripening or fruit colouration
Advanced ripening or fruit colouration, G: Soft dough stage
Fruit begins to soften (species with fleshy fruit), fruit ripe for picking
Fully ripe: fruit shows fully-ripe colour, beginning of fruit abscission
P: Shoot development completed, foliage still green, grapevine: after harvest, end of wood maturation
notes: No idea

field: Beginning of leaf-fall
50% of leaves fallen
End of leaf fall, plants or above ground parts dead or dormant, P Plant resting or dormant
notes: We don't include dormancy as a phenological stage.

field: Harvested product (post-harvest or storage treatment is applied at stage 99)
start of harvest
notes: Not a phenological stage. Too vague.

field: end of harvest
notes: Not a phenological stage. Too vague.

field: first cut for silage winning
first cut for silage winning (=> 50% of the area)
end of the first cut for silage winning (=> 90% of the area)
first cut for hay winning
notes: Not a phenological stage.

field: first cut for hay winning (=> 50% of the area)
end of first cut for hay winning (=> 90% of the area)
start of  harvest for silage (corn, grass)
start of Corn - cob - mix harvest for silage
25% of the permanent grassland shows fresh green
autumnal colouration: first discoloured leaves (sporadically)
start of autumnal colouration: leaves beginning of discolour (>=10%)
autumnal colouration: leaves beginning of discolour (>=20%)
autumnal colouration: leaves beginning of discolour (>=30%)
autumnal colouration: leaves beginning of discolour (>=40%)
autumnal colouration: leaves beginning of discolour (=>50%)
autumnal colouration: leaves beginning of discolour (=>60%)
autumnal colouration: leaves beginning of discolour (=>70%)
autumnal colouration: leaves beginning of discolour (=>80%)
end of autumnal colouration: nearly all leaves are discoloured (>=90%)
autumnal leaf fall: first fallen leaves (sporadically)
autumnal leaf fall: >=20% of leaves fallen
autumnal leaf fall: >=30% of leaves fallen
autumnal leaf fall: >=40% of leaves fallen
autumnal leaf fall: >=60% of leaves fallen
autumnal leaf fall: >=70% of leaves fallen
autumnal leaf fall: >=80% of leaves fallen
Leaf unfolding (>=50%)
Grapevine bleeding, pruned grapes start to loss water from the cuts
notes: No idea

field: first ripe fruits
50 % autumnal leaf fall
Autumnal coloring of leaves (50%)
Beginning of flowering
Beginning of sprouting
Coloring of leaves (100%)
End of autumnal leaf fall (95% fallen)
End of flowering
First flower buds visible
First leaves seperated (mouse ear)
First ripe fruits
Flowering 10% (male)

field: Fruits fully ripe
Full flowering
notes: Check if this means 100% open flowers.

field: Harvest
Leaf unfolding (5.true leaves, leaf pairs or whoris unfolded)
Leaf unfolding (50%)
